com.sri.common.net
Class SRISocket

java.lang.Object
  com.sri.common.net.SRISocket
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class SRISocket
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

This class implements SRTP (Smart Robots Transfer Protocol). SRTP is modeled closely after the HTTP protocol. Its structure consists of a header containing request information followed by the data. Clients written in Java will use this class to implement the SRTP protocol.

This class contains the needed methods to read and write data using the SRTP protocol. Be aware that when this method is instanciated, a new thread will be created for reading from the underlying network socket. The Thread object can be retrieved from the getThread() method to allow the thread to be joined, for instance.

Version:
1.5
Author:
Joseph Monti, Smart Robots

Constructor Detail

SRISocket

public SRISocket(SRISocketReader reader,
                 java.lang.String site,
                 int port,
                 java.lang.String username,
                 java.lang.String pass)
This is used to open a new socket with the given [site] and [port]. Implementing clients should use this constructor, as opposed to the other. In addition to creating the socket and initiating the objects, it also creates a new thread for the run() method.

Parameters:
reader - The reader to which recieved data should be sent.
site - The IP address of the server with which to connect.
port - The Port on the server with which to connect.
username - The username used for authentication.
pass - The password used for authentication.
See Also:
run()

SRISocket

public SRISocket(SRISocketReader reader,
                 java.net.Socket socket,
                 java.lang.String username,
                 java.lang.String pass)
This is used when an existing Socket has been create. This is meant to be used by the server, from which it will send an accepted socket. This also creates a new thread for the run() method.

Parameters:
reader - The reader to which recieved data should be sent.
socket - The network socket with which the connection was made.
username - The username used for authentication.
pass - The password used for authentication.
See Also:
run()

keepAlive

public void keepAlive(boolean k)
Sets the keep alive status. This is called when Connection is set to "keep-alive" from the SRTP protocol.

Parameters:
k - The keep alive status.

This will write the text [s] to the socket using the SRTP protocol.

Returns:
true if the text was sent, false otherwise.

close

public void close()
This will instruct the reader that the connection is being closed, and then close the underlying socket.

run

public void run()
This method runs as a separate thread. It waits for incoming data and attempts to parse it as SRTP. When valid SRTP has been recieved a corresponding method in the reader is called.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
